elements.name: question1
elements.title:
How many locations within your organization handle personal information from Europe?
A location is defined as any place where an employee principally works. 

Personal information is any information that alone or with other information can identify a living person. Personal information includes: name, home address, business address, email, cell phone number, work number, employee ID number, usernames and passwords, etc.

Personal information can come from employees, customers, users, partners, etc.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Please answer questions for each of them

templateElements.name: s5q2
templateElements.title: What is the address of location ?

templateElements.name: question3
templateElements.title: What categories of personal information does location handle?

choices.text: Identifying information
Opinions, beliefs, or personal preference data
Physical characteristics data
Personal history data
Social and contact information
Financial data
Tracking data

templateElements.name: s5q6i1
templateElements.title:
What is included in the "Identifying information" at location ?
Sample answer: "Phone numbers, emails, addresses, and dates of birth"

templateElements.name: s5q7i1
templateElements.title:
Who is the "Identifying information" at location collected from? 
Sample answer: "The personal information is collected from users of our mobile app." 

Other types of people include: patients, customers, employees, students, system users, device users, etc.

templateElements.name: question4
templateElements.title: Click all that apply to the "Identifying information" handled at location ?

choices.text: The organization received consent to handle the personal information.
The organization is under contract to handle the personal information.
The organization has a legal obligation to handle the personal information.
The organization is protecting people's vital interest (or a third-party's vital interest) by handling the personal information.
The organization is protecting a public interest by handling the personal information.
The organization has a legitimate business interest in handling the information.

templateElements.name: s5q9i1
templateElements.title:
What is your organization doing with the "Identifying information" at location ?
Sample answer: "The organization uses the identifying information to track how users interact with our products. The organization provides that information to third parties who help determine how to better market the products. When the organization is finished with the information, it stores the data on external, third-party servers." 

Other uses include: selling the information, improving user experiences, providing services, authenticating accounts, etc

templateElements.name: s5q10i1
templateElements.title:
What does your organization plan to do with the "Identifying information" at location in the future?
This question may seem repetitive, but it's important to note your future plans. 

Sample answer: "The organization plans to use the identifying information to track how users interact with our products. The organization also plans to provide the information to third parties to help determine how to better market those products." 

Other plans include: selling the information, improving user experiences, providing services, authenticating accounts, etc.

templateElements.name: s5q11i1
templateElements.title:
What departments within your organization handle the "Identifying information" at location ?
Sample answer: "The organization's marketing and sales departments handle the personal information."

Other departments include: human resources, security, IT, accounting, etc.

templateElements.name: question5
templateElements.title:
Does your organization share the "Identifying information" at location with third parties?
Third parties include: subsidiaries, affiliates, vendors, software developers, cloud service providers, etc.

templateElements.name: s5q13i1
templateElements.title:
Name those organizations.
Sample answer: "Marketing Enterprises and Amazon Web Services"

You will need to remember these organizations when you complete the next document: Record of Processing (External). You may want to write them down.

templateElements.name: s5q14i1
templateElements.title:
In what countries are those organizations located?
Sample answer: "USA, Canada and Mexico"

templateElements.name: s5q15i1
templateElements.title:
What safeguards are in place to protect the "Identifying information" at location when it is transferred to another organization?
Sample answer: "The organization transfers the personal information to the third party via an encrypted FTP site. The organization also audits how the third party vendors uses the information every quarter." 

Other safeguards include: secure transfer, encryption, periodic audits, firewalls, etc.

templateElements.name: question6
templateElements.title: Does your organization plan to share the "Identifying information" at location with third parties in the future?

templateElements.name: s5q17i1
templateElements.title:
Name the organizations.
Sample answer: "Marketing Enterprises and Amazon Web Services"

templateElements.name: s5q18i1
templateElements.title:
After your organization is finished with the "Identifying information" at location , how long does your organization expect to retain it?
Sample answer: "2 years"

templateElements.name: question7
templateElements.title:
Rate the risk to the confidentiality of the "Identifying information" at location #1.
"Risk to confidentiality" means unauthorized disclosure or access to the information.

templateElements.name: question8
templateElements.title:
Rate the risk to the integrity of the "Identifying information" at location.
"Risk to integrity" means unintended alteration or destruction of the information.

templateElements.name: question9
templateElements.title:
Rate the risk to the accessibility of the "Identifying information" at location.
"Risk to accessibility" means loss of the information.

templateElements.name: s5q22i1
templateElements.title:
What organizational measures are in place to secure the "Identifying information" at location?
Sample answer:"The organization has policies and procedures in place for handling personal information. Employees receive training in accordance with those policies and procedures. The organization also audits how it handles personal information every quarter." 

Other organizational measures include: reporting procedures, etc.

templateElements.name: s5q23i1
templateElements.title:
What physical measures are in place at your organization to secure the "Identifying information" at location?
Sample answer: "The organization requires ID badges to enter the facilities. There are also security personnel on site 24 hours per day. There are security cameras in every hall and at the entrances."

Other physical measures include: locks, physical barriers, etc.

templateElements.name: s5q24i1
templateElements.title:
What technical measures are in place at your organization to secure the "Identifying information" at location ?
Sample answer: "The organization has two-factor authentication on its login process. It also employs anti-malware software." 

Technical measures include: firewalls, segmented data, account authentication, etc.
